qolmat.imputations.rpca.temporal_rpca.OnlineTemporalRPCA

class qolmat.imputations.rpca.temporal_rpca.OnlineTemporalRPCA(n_rows: Optional[int] = None, rank: Optional[int] = None, tau: Optional[float] = None, lam: Optional[float] = None, list_periods: Optional[List[int]] = [], list_etas: Optional[List[float]] = [], maxIter: Optional[int] = 10000, tol: Optional[float] = 1e-06, verbose: Optional[bool] = False, norm: Optional[str] = 'L2', burnin: Optional[float] = 0, nwin: Optional[float] = 0, online_tau: Optional[float] = None, online_lam: Optional[float] = None, online_list_etas: Optional[Union[numpy.typing._array_like._SupportsArray[numpy.dtype], numpy.typing._nested_sequence._NestedSequence[numpy.typing._array_like._SupportsArray[numpy.dtype]], bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes, numpy.typing._nested_sequence._NestedSequence[Union[bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes]]]] = [])[source]

This class implements an online version of Temporal RPCA that processes one sample per time instance and hence its memory cost is independent of the number of samples It is based on stochastic optimization of an equivalent reformulation of the batch TemporalRPCA

Parameters
TemporalRPCA

Methods

compute_L1(proj_D, omega[, return_basis])

compute RPCA with possible temporal regularisations, penalised with L1 norm

compute_L2(proj_D, omega[, return_basis])

compute RPCA with possible temporal regularisations, penalised with L2 norm

fit_transform(signal)

Compute an online version of RPCA with temporal regularisations
